awd_abstract_narration:
The Oakland Urban Teacher Residency program (OUTR) is a partnership among Mills College's Division of Natural Science and Mathematics and its School of Education, the Oakland Unified School District (OUSD), the Lawrence Hall of Science, and KQED Public Media for Northern California. The project is recruiting, preparing, mentoring and sustaining a cadre of 20 STEM teachers based on a medical residency model in which new Teaching Fellows are mentored by experienced master teachers---a model which complements the instructional rounds model that OUSD has implemented in each of their secondary schools. A key component of OUTR is engaging the Teaching Fellows, the Fellows' mentors, and the program's partners in a research project to study this teacher residency model in order to determine how the skills and knowledge of STEM pre-service teachers develop over time within connected, coherent learning communities. 

OUTR partners and participants produce research that adds to the knowledge base about effective STEM residency models of teacher preparation and retention in high-needs urban school districts. In addition, the project supports cadres of new teachers to enter and remain for at least four years in OUSD after their initial preparation year, providing strong content knowledge, effective pedagogies that are designed for teaching Oakland students, and knowledge of observing, monitoring and increasing student learning. Thus, the project increases the number, diversity, and mastery of secondary STEM teachers in OUSD, while improving student learning, and faculty learning about learning, for others similarly situated.

por.por_cntn:
Objective #1: Strengthen OUSD, Mills, and LHS institutional partnership

Progress to Date:Via a UTRU facilitated strategy meeting, stakeholders from across the partnership cametogether to discuss a shared vision for the OUTR program and create program impact goals.

Outcomes to Date:

  • Five impact goals were drafted, focusing on impacting communications within and acrossthe overall partnership; delivering context-relevant preparation; mentoring; programsustainability; and induction
  • Attendees examined the original mission statement as articulated in the grant andmodified/added language representing all parties’ beliefs and values
  • An OUTR design team comprised of representatives from Mills, the OUSD, and an OEAliaison was established

 

Objective #2: Engage OUTR partners in collaboratively implementing a targeted recruitmentcampaign to attract diverse, high-achieving teacher candidates

Outcomes to Date:

  • The OUTR Design Team collaborated to plan and execute OUTR’s first selection day, withparticipation from Mills, OEA, and OUSD HR and C&I; the team piloted new and innovativestrategies for resident selection in the STEM fields

Objective #3: Develop and implement rigorous, performance-based selection processes andprotocols for mentor and site selection

Outcomes to Date:

  • Design Team created drafts of mentor and site selection criteria and outlined a process forselection, including creation of a letter and flyer to distribute to potential mentors andtraining site principals, and a narrow list of potential training site schools based on OUSD data
  • Design Team members from the OUSD LCI department leveraged the power of relationshipsto find potential program mentors

Objective #4: Examine and integrate residency year coursework and clinical experiences toprepare graduates for OUSDP

Outcomes to Date:

  • Design team to create a short and savvy one-pager to market OUTR to principals
  • OUSD and Mills plan to map existing PD and candidate curricula, respectively, onto OUSDframework for effective teaching to identify areas of alignment, gap, and need
  • The OUTR design team will meet in early June to determine next steps from OUSDframework analysis and identify areas to innovate existing curriculum
  • Members from the design team plan to touch base with OUSD BTSA coordinators to buildtheir awareness of OUTR and potentially discuss overlap with mentoring support

Last Modified: 07/12/2022
Modified by: Wendi S Williams
